source:
library(tidyverse)
library(ggpubr)

create_plot <- function(tib, title, ylab, ylims, tick_units, rotation_angle) {
  "
  tib: a tibble with three columns: sex, diet, and then the column from the original data to be plotted (named \"values\")
  title: the title for the plot
  ylab: the y-axis label for the plot
  ylims: a vector with two numeric values specifying the y limits
  tick_units: a vector specifying by what value the tick marks should increase on the y-axis
  rotation_angle: a number indicating the number of degrees to rotate the x-axis labels
  "
  tib <- tib %>% group_by(Sex,Diet) %>% summarise(avg=mean(values), stdev=sd(values)) %>% mutate(sexdiet = paste0(Diet,"-",Sex))
  tib$sexdiet <- factor(tib$sexdiet, levels=tib$sexdiet)
  
  plt <- ggplot(tib, aes(x=sexdiet, y=avg)) +
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=(avg-stdev), ymax=(avg+stdev)), width=0.3) +
    geom_bar(mapping = aes(fill=sexdiet), stat="identity", width=0.7) +
    xlab("") +
    ggtitle(title) +
    rotate_x_text(angle=rotation_angle) +
    theme(plot.title=element_text(hjust=0.5)) +
    scale_y_continuous(name=ylab, breaks=seq(ylims[1], ylims[2], by=tick_units), expand=c(0,0)) +
    expand_limits(y=ylims) +
    theme(panel.grid.major = element_blank(), panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
            panel.background = element_blank(), axis.line = element_line(colour = "black", size=1)) +
    scale_fill_manual(values=c("#000000", "#a0a0a4", "#808080", "#d4d4d4")) +
    guides(fill=FALSE)
    
  return(plt)
}

# Download the data, suppressing printed messages and warnings
suppressWarnings(suppressMessages(data <- read_csv('https://raw.github.com/jtbeales/reproducibility_project/master/reproducibility_project_data.csv') %>% 
  rename(adj_CTRP3 = `Adjusted CTRP3`, adj_adiponectin = `Adjusted Adiponectin`) %>% select(Sex:adj_adiponectin)))

# Standardize names
data$Sex <- gsub("Female", "F", data$Sex)
data$Sex <- gsub("Male", "M", data$Sex)
data$Diet <- gsub("Control", "Con", data$Diet)
data$Diet <- gsub("Ethanol", "E", data$Diet)
data$Diet <- gsub("E", "ETOH", data$Diet)

# Create individual plots
p1 <- data %>% select(Sex,Diet,Adiponectin) %>% rename(values = Adiponectin) 
p1 <- create_plot(p1, "Adiponectin mRNA", "Log Starting Quantity\n(per 25 ng RNA)", c(0,5),1,45)

p2 <- data %>% select(Sex,Diet,CTRP3) %>% rename(values = CTRP3) 
p2 <- create_plot(p2, "CTRP3 mRNA", "Log Starting Quantity\n(per 25 ng RNA)", c(0,4),1,45) 

p3 <- data %>% select(Sex,Diet,HPRT) %>% rename(values = HPRT) 
p3 <- create_plot(p3, "HPRT mRNA", "Log Starting Quantity\n(per 25 ng RNA)", c(0,6),2,45) 

p4 <- data %>% select(Sex,Diet,Actin) %>% rename(values = Actin) 
p4 <- create_plot(p4, "Actin mRNA", "Log Starting Quantity\n(per 25 ng RNA)", c(0,5),1,45) 

p5 <- data %>% select(Sex,Diet,adj_adiponectin) %>% rename(values = adj_adiponectin) 
p5 <- create_plot(p5, "Adiponectin mRNA", "Relative mRNA expression", c(0,1.5),0.5,0) 

p6 <- data %>% select(Sex,Diet,adj_CTRP3) %>% rename(values = adj_CTRP3) 
p6 <- create_plot(p6, "CTRP3 mRNA", "Relative mRNA expression", c(0,1.0),0.2,0) 

# Merge plots into one
final <- ggarrange(p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,p6, labels = c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E", "F"), ncol = 2, nrow = 3, align="v")

# Save final plot as pdf file
ggsave('final.pdf', final, width=8.286, height=9.84)

# View final plot
final
